pageContent: Goals of work: Patients with prostate cancer metastasized to bone frequently experience skeletal morbidities as a result of their disease. We sought to quantify the longitudinal effects on patient-reported outcomes of skeletal-related events (SREs) and to ascertain the declines in health-related quality of life (HRQOL) and pain experienced by patients who experienced SREs.

metaData.source:
Impact of previous radiotherapy for prostate cancer on clinical outcomes of patients with bladder cancer
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/20299035/
